conversation.message: That is an excellent question and truly central to our pedagogy. We achieve this balance through 'intentional teaching within emergent contexts.' Structured activities, such as focused literacy or numeracy centers, are brief and integrated directly into the children's current interests (the 'play-based' element). For example, if children are building a fort (play), the structured activity might involve calculating required materials or writing a 'Keep Out' sign (structure). We ensure dedicated free-play time remains paramount, but our educators are trained to introduce specific learning objectives organically during those play sessions. This approach ensures learning is meaningful, child-led, yet meets necessary developmental milestones. We hope this insight confirms why we would be an excellent fit for your child.
